dt: {bc}to increase the extent, number, volume, or scope of {bc}{sx|enlarge||}
{bc}to express at length or in greater detail

dt.t: {wi}expand{/wi} a function in a power series

dt: {bc}to increase in extent, number, volume, or scope
{bc}to speak or write fully or in detail

pt: {sc}expand{/sc} {sc}amplify{/sc} {sc}swell{/sc} {sc}distend{/sc} {sc}inflate{/sc} {sc}dilate{/sc} mean to increase in size or volume. {sc}expand{/sc} may apply regardless of the manner of increase (such as growth, unfolding, addition of parts).
{sc}amplify{/sc} implies the extension or enlargement of something inadequate.
{sc}swell{/sc} implies gradual expansion beyond a thing's original or normal limits.
{sc}distend{/sc} implies outward extension caused by pressure from within.
{sc}inflate{/sc} implies expanding by introduction of air or something insubstantial and suggests a vulnerability to sudden collapse.
{sc}dilate{/sc} applies especially to expansion of circumference.

et: Middle English {it}expaunden{/it}, from Latin {it}expandere{/it}, from {it}ex-{/it} + {it}pandere{/it} to spread {ma}{mat|fathom|}{/ma}
shortdef: to increase the extent, number, volume, or scope of : enlarge
to express at length or in greater detail

dt: {bc}sheet metal cut and expanded into a lattice and used especially as lath

shortdef: sheet metal cut and expanded into a lattice and used especially as lath

dt: {bc}lightweight cellular plastic used especially as insulation and protective packing material

shortdef: lightweight cellular plastic used especially as insulation and protective packing material —called also foamed plastic, plastic foam
